titles.title: Providing for the consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-335, by Mr. Diaz-Balart.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 109.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 314.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

POSTPONED ROLL CALL VOTE - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 314, the Chair put the question on adoption of the resolution and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Diaz-Balart objected to the voice vote based upon the absence of a quorum and pursuant to the rule, the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question until later in the legislative day. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 306 - 100 (Roll no. 498).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 12/13/2001--Passed House without amendment. Makes it in order at any time on December 19, 2001, for the Speaker of the House of Representatives to entertain motions that the House suspend the rules.
